abstract: For Google, the future of social networks is not Orkut. For Yahoo, it’s not Yahoo Mash. Both are betting that e-mail and personal home pages can be extended to undercut the activity now on Facebook and MySpace.
snippet: For Google, the future of social networks is not Orkut. For Yahoo, it’s not Yahoo Mash. Both are betting that e-mail and personal home pages can be extended to undercut the activity now on Facebook and MySpace.
lead_paragraph: Ignore Orkut, OpenSocial, Yahoo Mash and Yahoo 360. Google and Yahoo have come up with new and very similar plans to respond to the challenge from MySpace and Facebook: They hope to turn their e-mail systems and personalized home page services (iGoogle and MyYahoo) into social networks.

headline.main: Inbox 2.0: Yahoo and Google to Turn E-Mail Into a Social Network
